arts.ttl: Inter Captain Relieved After Ending Scoring Drought: “It Was Important to Start Scoring Again”
arts.sum: Inter star Lautaro Martinez opened his Serie A account for the 2024/25 season with a match-winning brace against Udinese on Saturday. The Argentine forward netted on either side of halftime to inspire Simone Inzaghi's side to an all-important 3-2 victory at the Bluenergy Stadium. The post Inter Captain Relieved After Ending Scoring Drought: “It Was Important to Start Scoring Again” appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Inter Player Ratings vs Udinese: Captain is Back
arts.sum: Reigning Serie A champions Inter bounced back from last weekend's derby defeat against Milan with an enthralling 3-2 win against Udinese. Simone Inzaghi's side posted their fourth consecutive victory against the Friulians as Lautaro Martinez finally got off the mark in the 2024/25 season. The post Inter Player Ratings vs Udinese: Captain is Back appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Runjaic: “We gave away easy goals, Inter deserved the win.”
arts.sum: Udinese head coach Kosta Runjaic spoke to DAZN and later in a press conference following his team’s 3-2 loss to Inter Milan. Despite the defeat, Runjaic found positives in his team’s performance against the reigning Italian champions. Runjaic began by acknowledging the entertaining nature of the match: “It was an enjoyable game for the fans. We know Inter’s quality, they scored easy goals, we conceded simple chances. We tried to play until the end, maybe with a miracle or a bit of luck we could have equalized. There are two sides to the coin: we played openly but we lost.” The post Runjaic: “We gave away easy goals, Inter deserved the win.” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Lautaro Martinez: “After the derby we talked less and worked more”
arts.sum: Lautaro Martinez finally found his scoring touch, netting a crucial brace to lead Inter Milan to a 3-2 victory over Udinese. The Argentine striker, who had gone goalless in the first five Serie A matches, spoke to DAZN after the game about his performance and the team’s response following their derby defeat. Martinez began by acknowledging the challenging nature of the match: “We suffered a bit, we know the team we were facing. This is always a difficult field for us, but after the derby, we talked less and worked a lot, and I think it showed on the field.” The post Lautaro Martinez: “After the derby we talked less and worked more” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Inzaghi ‘very satisfied’ with Inter’s 3-2 win over Udinese
arts.sum: Inter Milan returned to winning ways after their derby defeat, securing a 3-2 victory against Udinese at the Bluenergy Stadium. Lautaro Martinez broke his scoring drought with a brace, netting his first goals of the season. After the match, coach Simone Inzaghi shared his thoughts with DAZN. Inzaghi began by praising his team’s performance: “First and foremost, I want to say that the boys were fantastic. I’m very satisfied and I congratulated them because Udinese is a good team and Inter played a very good first half. The only flaw was not scoring a few more goals.” He acknowledged some The post Inzaghi ‘very satisfied’ with Inter’s 3-2 win over Udinese appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Udinese 2-3 Inter: Match Report
arts.sum: Inter Milan bounced back from recent setbacks with a hard-fought 3-2 win over Udinese at the Dacia Arena. The Nerazzurri, looking to recover from a draw with Monza and a derby defeat to AC Milan, found their scoring touch through Lautaro Martinez and Davide Frattesi. The match started explosively, with Frattesi opening the scoring just 43 seconds into the game. The midfielder, starting in place of the injured Nicolò Barella, capitalized on a Darmian through ball to catch Udinese goalkeeper Maduka Okoye off guard. Udinese, who had been in good form, equalized through Christian Kabasele’s glancing header from a corner. The post Serie A | Udinese 2-3 Inter: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.
